Entries.default: No sooner do you approach the Vailian woman than she squints and turns up her nose, regarding you with thinly-veiled distaste.
"Something you need, aimico?" Aenia lifts her brow and waits.
Entries.female: "Something you need, aimica?" Aenia lifts her brow and waits.

Entries.default: "Farewell."
"What bounties do you have available?"
"We will cut your teeth on Biakara, a Huana sailor and would-be patriot who plagues Company ships."
"I'll take the bounty."
"I'll pass on the bounty for now."
"Gellarde. Biakara sails her voyager Scale of Tangaloa off of Hasongo's northeastern coast." Aenia studies you once more before shrugging and seeing you off with a wave.
"But you have your quarry already! Once the target is sunk, come back to me for another."
Entries.female: "But aimica, you have your quarry. Once you have silenced the first, I will give you another."

Entries.default:
"The Company is always eager to hunt pirates. My contacts have one by the name of Veen in their spyglass."

Aenia hesitates before speaking up again.
"I'll take the bounty."

"Gellarde. You can catch up to Veen as he sails the dhow 'Reckless' far east of Neketaka, past the Kua o Rikuhu islands, no doubt thinking himself beyond our reach." 

Aenia grins to herself and nods.
"I dealt with Biakara."
"I dealt with Veen."
"I dealt with Desiwa the Shark."

"Belfetto! A fitting test of your skills and a promising beginning for us both." 

She winks and passes you a small pouch of coins.

"Belfetto! A pirate deserves no better send-off than a watery tomb." 

Aenia passes you a hefty bag of coins.

"Belfetto! For once our survey ships may take to the waters without fear. Knowing that is almost priceless." 

She strains her back to support a sack of coins and lays it at your feet.

"You've taken all the work from the louses of Queen's Berth and I have nothing more to offer you... save this." 

Hesitating, Aenia sticks out her hand and tips her head to the side, wearing an awkward smile.
"Merla, how is every ship hunter taken?"
"Excellent work. I wish all ship hunters were so diligent."
Entries.female: "The Vailian Trading Company thanks you for your diligent work, mestra!"

Entries.default: "I've already dealt with Biakara."
"I've already dealt with Veen."
"You've done well for the company. My last target is Desiwa the Shark, a Rauataian casità who we suspect of intimidating survey ships." Her lip pulls back in a hate-filled sneer.
"I'll take the bounty."
"I've already dealt with Desiwa."
"Gellarde. Desiwa sails the dhow Blacktip in the waters south of Sayuka."
"I only deal with serious clients. Now shoo." She makes a sweeping gesture with both hands.
"Per complancanet, do you hate money? Speak to me when you are ready, then." Her brow furrows as she studies you.
"I'm still hunting Desiwa the Shark."
"I'm still hunting Veen."
"I'm still hunting Biakara."
"Well, the Queen's Berth ship hunters are not exactly pounding at my door for work." Aenia pinches the bridge of her nose.
"Enjoy the lack of competition while it lasts. Take your time."
"Before I go I had some questions."
"Farewell."
"Questions? Ask your questions, aimico."
"Excuse me?"
"What sort of business are you in?"
[Stand your ground.] "I am a serious client."
"Ac, done! You are dismissed."
"Madiccho, but it is impossible to find skilled work when every competent freelancer wastes their shore leave in the Wild Mare!" She grimaces toward the east.
"When blood travels south of their brains the value of a good bounty is forgotten."
"You give out bounties? I could take some off your hands."
"Why aren't more sailors accepting work?"
"Sounds like fun. Farewell."
"A serious brute - I can see this from here."
"Not the business of answering questions, nasenale."
"You? A nameless face off the streets?" She thumbs her chin and gives you a thorough looking-over.
"I do not make a habit of shepherding new talent, but... ac, there is a seed of potential." She sighs to herself and peers over your shoulder before giving up and addressing you directly.

"Hm... your face, perhaps it is not unknown to me."

She thumbs her chin and appraises you with fresh interest.
"Ac, but I blame luminous adra." She folds her arms and exhales sharply through her nose.
"Our privateers are busy escorting shipments out of the Deadfire. Everyone is rich, no one is hungry!"
"Where are the casitàs willing to sink their enemies for a bag of pires, eh? Drunk on success!" She waves derisively toward the east.
"Ac, but too much eagerness can be a bad thing."
"It goes without saying that I have more work for you if you have the space for more coin." Aenia chuckles to herself.
"But you did not just come to deliver good news? You came for work, ac?"
[Shake her hand.] "Been a pleasure working with you, Aenia."
"Farewell."
"Ac, my little privateer! You have news for me?" Aenia folds her arms and tips her head.
"Veen is a vithrack, if such things matter to you. Gets in your head, they say."
